    English characters.Use the following lines as examples:
    I'm going to the library. Kal wahan bahut shor tha. Let's see if it's quiet today.
    Tumne kal ka match dekha? It was really exciting. Sab log stadium mein cheer kar rahe the.
    We should leave early. Raste mein traffic ho sakta hai. Better to be on time.
    Maine usse kal phone kiya. She didn't pick up. Shayad woh busy thi.
    Let's grab some coffee. Mujhe neend aa rahi hai. After that, we can continue working.
    Aaj mausam bahut accha hai. The sky looks so clear. Hum thoda walk kar lete hain.
    He always works late. Uske colleagues pareshaan hote hain. But they respect his dedication.
    Kal exam hai. I still have two chapters left. Mujhe raat ko padhna padega.
    We were planning a trip. Maine tickets book kar li hain. Everyone is excited now.
    She loves dancing. Usne bachpan se training li hai. That's why she performs so confidently.

Person1: Hey Alex, I just started revising for the searching algorithms midterm and I could use some fresh perspective.  
Person2: Sure, happy to help! As a project manager on AWS, I’ve been thinking about how binary search can be applied to large data sets in the cloud.  
Person1: I’m also trying to decide whether to focus more on the implementation details or the theoretical analysis, <Hindi>क्या आपको लगता है कि अभ्यास की कुंजी डेटा स्ट्रक्चर पर है</Hindi>?  
Person2: I think both are important, but I always recommend writing a quick BFS and DFS example on a sample graph first to solidify the concepts.  
Person1: That’s a good point; I’ll code a small BFS function in Python and then compare its performance to DFS on an adjacency list.  
Person2: Exactly; the time complexity analysis for BFS is O(V+E) and for DFS it’s also O(V+E), but the space usage differs due to recursion stack size.  
Person1: When I’m practicing, I sometimes get confused about the order in which nodes are visited, <Hindi>क्या यह सही है कि BFS queue के साथ विज़िट करता है</Hindi>?  
Person2: Yes, BFS uses a queue, so it visits all neighbors before moving to the next level, while DFS usually uses a stack or recursion to go deep first.  
Person1: I’ll also prepare a quick summary of the classic binary search pseudocode, making sure to note the invariants and how to handle edge cases.  
Person2: If you want to test it on a real dataset, you could spin up an AWS Lambda function and run binary search on a sorted list stored in S3.  
Person1: By the way, I’m feeling a bit nervous about the exam, <Hindi>क्या आप कुछ टिप्स दे सकते हैं</Hindi>?  
Person2: Stay calm, review the key theorems, practice coding in a timed setting, and remember that understanding the underlying logic beats memorizing code.
